name: Crème Brûlée
description: A rich custard base topped with a contrasting layer of hard caramel, achieved by torching a layer of sugar on top.
steps: Heat cream with vanilla bean until just hot.
Whisk yolks with sugar until pale, then slowly add the hot cream.
Bake in a water bath until set but still trembling in the center.
Cool, then sprinkle sugar on top and torch until caramelized.
ingredients: 100 grams sugar, plus extra for topping
tips: Ensure the sugar is evenly spread before torching for a uniform caramel layer.
Cool the custards in the refrigerator for several hours to set properly before serving.
Use a propane torch for best results when caramelizing the sugar.
